alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pinal County; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:10PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 400 PM MST... At 309 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from 12 miles southeast of Maricopa to 7 miles north of Casa Grande to Randolph. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, and generate blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Casa Grande, Coolidge, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, San Tan Valley, Bapchule, Estrella Sailport, Olberg, Arizola, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph, Blackwater, Chandler Heights, Toltec, Magma and Coolidge Airport. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 167 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 150 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pinal County; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; West Pinal County
